note: Z3 flavor Yukawa texture inputs (v2.4/v2.5 transition). This file encodes explicit conventions that are only implicit/ambiguous in older documents.

yukawa_texture.formula: Y^(y) = y_* [ C(delta) + a_y * varphi0 * D + b * c3 * I ],  D=diag(1,0,-1)

y_star_scaling.targets: third-generation Yukawas at the mt boundary (yt from mt_MSbar(mt); yb, ytau from inputs)

topology_phase_atoms.note: Docking point for topology→phase derivation: Appendix J (paper_v1_06_01_09_2025.tex) sketches three boundary cycles (C1,C2,CT) on the orientable double cover. Wilson lines along these cycles encode discrete phase atoms; topology_phase_map now emits an explicit holonomy-class → (δ, δ_CP) candidate map (still assumption-explicit, not an operator derivation).

wiring.pmns_theta_scan_note: If topology_phase_map outputs are present under the run output dir, pmns_full_pipeline will scan a small finite set of texture phases θ derived from the Wilson-line atoms. In filter_only mode the PMNS convention is fixed by mass-splitting canonicalization (no χ²-driven convention shopping).

ckm_variants.note: Discrete CKM construction variants (no continuous fit). The CKM pipeline will evaluate each variant at μ=mt and mark the lowest-χ² variant as the current front-runner.
ckm_variants.topology_delta_cp_note: If topology_phase_map outputs are present under the run output dir, ckm_full_pipeline will (in filter_only mode) evaluate only topological δ_CP candidates (Wilson-line atoms), i.e. a derived filter, not a χ²-driven search over phases.

joint_objective_policy.note: Weights for the CKM+PMNS joint objective. Weights are policy inputs, not tuned. Mass-ratio penalty uses lepton ratios anchored by the Möbius δ input.

neutrino_mechanism.note: Controls how pmns_full_pipeline constructs κ(mt) and yN. Use mechanism_bridge to avoid convention/labeling artifacts and to tie PMNS angles to the Z3-breaking constraint layer (TM1 baseline + ε=varphi0/6).
